Is there a genocide in Gaza? Why legal experts are split
description: Genocide, as defined by the 1948 convention, requires both certain criminal acts to be committed and genocidal intent. While the requisite acts have been proven in Gaza, legal scholars are divided over the intent. South Africa has filed a genocide complaint against Israel with the International Court of Justice in The Hague.

description: Alongside Druze civilians, who were the main targets of the communal clashes that bloodied the region in mid-July, families of herders and farmers also faced summary executions.

headline: Women's Euro 2025: Defending champions England beat Spain on penalties
description: Defeating Spain helps make up for the pain of losing the World Cup final in 2023, and England's victory also confirms Wiegman's place among the coaching greats.

headline: Novelist Peter Handke: 'To die in the middle of writing a book, that would be magnificent!'
description: The Austrian writer and 2019 Nobel Prize in Literature laureate looked back on nearly 60 years of his career, discussing the twists and turns of the desire to write, which continue to drive him to this day.

headline: In Germany, the LGBTQ+ flag is at the heart of a new culture war
description: The Bundestag president's refusal to fly the rainbow flag atop the parliamentary building during Berlin's annual parade in support of sexual and gender minority rights on July 26 has sparked controversy across Germany.

headline: Retracing James Baldwin's footsteps in Istanbul, the city that saved his life
description: The American author and playwright first set foot in Istanbul in 1961, at the age of 36. Turkey was then alive with an artistic and intellectual effervescence, and for 10 years it became his refuge – a place of celebration and intense literary creation.
